snippet: The king of the AbaThembu clan has started a 12-year sentence for arson, kidnapping and assault, local news media reported on Thursday.
abstract: Buyelekhaya Dalindyebo, king of AbaThembu clan in South Africa, is beginning 12-year sentence for arson, kidnapping, and assault; had fought 2009 conviction for years before turning himself in.
lead_paragraph: The king of the AbaThembu clan has started a 12-year sentence for arson, kidnapping and assault, local news media reported on Thursday.

headline.main: South Africa: A King Goes to Prison
headline.print_headline: Africa; South Africa: A King Goes to Prison
